results.title: The Drover
results.brief_description: The romantic days of droving are recalled in this film which illustrates the day to day life led by the drover on a long and lonely trip in the great Australian outback.

results.title: Drought in Botswana
results.creator_credit: Harold Eastwood, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and United Nations
results.brief_description: Illustrates the World Food Program famine relief in Botswana which began in 1965 after five years of drought had decimated the country. Relief was provided for over 100,000 Kalahari bushmen. Covers tribal traditions and all aspects of the assistance program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold Eastwood, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and United Nations

results.title: The Dropout
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: Shows reasons for many youths leaving school without reaching leaving standard through dramatised typical cases. Causes are complex, including home background, attitude of parents, emphasis on possessions in a commercial society and pressure to achieve independence. Suggests ways in which schools can help by attention to those left behind and discouraged and shows courses emphasising practical subjects and preparation for work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers

results.title: A Drop in the bucket
results.creator_credit: Joseph Henabery, United States. Public Health Service and Warner-Pathe News
results.brief_description: Dramatised story of how dentists, civic leaders, health officials, and people of a town agreed to add fluoride to the community water supply. Explains how the fluoride is added, the cost of fluoridation, and the benefits accruing to the community.

results.title: Driving without tears
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: We accompany a driving instructor to see how the City of Vancouver trains expert and responsible motorists. Shows how a driving school gives both theoretical and practical teaching on all the intricacies of city and highway traffic. The film includes reference to training programs in secondary schools to make teenagers better drivers.

results.title: Drip
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Many thousands of gallons of water are unnecessarily wasted every day in America - and all over the world, especially in affluent countries. This film stresses the need for a community “Save Water” campaign.

results.title: Drinking: how will Charlie handle it?
results.brief_description: The film presents a variety of social and emotional factors which can influence an individual’s decision about drinking. Considers abstinence, drinking in moderation, and a number of consequences of excessive drinking. The film offers no conclusions but is designed to promote thought and discussion about the decision-making process regarding drinking.

results.title: Drinking
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: By alternating live-action sequences and animated graphics, the film follows the behavioral and physiological transformations that are directly linked to consumption of alcohol. It shows the short-term and long-term effects on the human body.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Drilling a hole in a pin
results.brief_description: Shows the operation and sequences followed when drilling a hole in each end of a steel pin. Two methods are shown: drilling a layout, and drilling with a jig. Explains the reasons for each movement and emphasises various safety precautions.
